```javascriptreact
              {serviceData.map((service, index) => (
                <motion.div
                  key={index}
                  initial={{ y: '100%' }}
                  animate={{ y: index <= activeIndex ? '0%' : '100%' }}
                  transition={{ duration: 0.8, ease: [0.16, 1, 0.3, 1] }} // Smooth shutter
                  style={{
                    position: 'absolute',
                    top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
                    zIndex: index, // Stack order
                    backgroundColor: '#f0f0f0', 
                    overflow: 'hidden'
                  }}
                >
                  {/* Image with Parallax Reveal Effect */}
                  {/* The image moves slightly opposite to the container reveal */}
                  <motion.img
                    src={service.image}
                    alt={service.title}
                    initial={{ y: '-20%', scale: 1.1 }}
                    animate={{ 
                      y: index === activeIndex ? '0%' : (index < activeIndex ? '0%' : '-20%'),
                      scale: index === activeIndex ? 1 : 1.1
                    }}
                    transition={{ duration: 1.0, ease: "easeOut" }} // Slightly slower than container for parallax feel
                    style={{
                      width: '100%',
                      height: '100%',
                      objectFit: 'cover',
                      display: 'block'
                    }}
                  />
                  
                  {/* Optional Overlay Gradient for text readability if needed (not needed here as text is on left) */}
                </motion.div>
              ))}
            </div>

          </div>
        </div>
      </section>

      {/* FAQ Section */}
      <section style={{ maxWidth: '1000px', margin: '0 auto', padding: '12rem 2vw' }}>
         <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: '4rem', fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '4rem', textAlign: 'center' }}>
           Questions?
         </h2>
         <div>
           {faqData.map((item, i) => (
             <AccordionItem key={i} q={item.q} a={item.a} />
           ))}
         </div>
      </section>

      <Contact />
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicesPage;
```

I've updated the **Services Page** with the changes you requested:

1.  **Layout & Positioning**: I adjusted the sticky "pinned" section to start `120px` from the top (`top: 120px`) instead of `top: 0`. This ensures it clears the navbar and doesn't look cramped or "locked against the nav."
2.  **Visual Content**: I replaced the abstract widgets with **high-quality placeholder images** (sourced from Unsplash) relevant to each service (Strategy, Brand, Dev, Growth).
3.  **Animation**: I enhanced the "shutter" transition with a **Parallax Reveal** effect. As you scroll:
    *   The new image container slides up (like a shutter).
    *   The *image inside* slides slightly down (parallax) and scales from `1.1` to `1`. This creates a much more premium, cinematic "reveal" feeling compared to a simple sliding block.

You can check it now at `/services`. The interaction should feel smoother and visually richer.

I have refined the `Services.jsx` page to align more closely with the Homepage's detailed and structured aesthetic.

**Enhancements:**

1.  **Overview Strip Upgrade**:
    *   Converted the "What We Do" strip into a **4-column grid**.
    *   Added **vertical dividers** (`borderRight`) between items for a distinct "system" look.
    *   Centered the text within each grid cell.

2.  **Service Sections Structure**:
    *   Added **numbered markers** (01, 02, 03, 04) to each service section text block.
    *   Added a **top border** to each service section to clearly delineate them as they scroll.
    *   Increased padding to `6rem` for better breathing room.

3.  **FAQ Polish**:
    *   Added numbering (01, 02, etc.) to the questions.
    *   Aligned the question text to the top for better multi-line handling.
    *   Added a top border to the FAQ container itself for consistency.

These changes should give the page the "detailed and thought-through" feel you were looking for, matching the structural design language of the rest of the site. You can review it at `/services`.

I have reverted the "boxy" border changes in `src/pages/Services.jsx`, while keeping the structural enhancements that add the "detailed" feel without the heavy lines.

**Changes:**

3.  **FAQ Section**: Removed the top border from the main container. The individual items retain a very subtle separator for usability, but the overall container feels open.

This restores the clean, whitespace-driven aesthetic of the homepage while maintaining the improved layout structure and content hierarchy. You can check the updated look at `/services`.

I have increased the spacing as requested to match the visual reference and ensure the image is hidden on load.

**Changes applied:**
1.  **Hero Section Padding**: Increased top padding to `20rem` to match the `Statement` section's spacious look.
2.  **Overview Strip Spacing**: Increased the bottom margin of the "What We Do" strip to `25vh`. This ensures a significant buffer so the sticky image section starts well below the fold.
3.  **Service Section Height**: Increased the minimum height of each service section to `100vh`, giving the content more room to breathe as you scroll.

You can verify these changes at `/services`. The initial view should now be very clean, with just the large heading and subtext, similar to the homepage statement.

I have implemented the layout adjustments for the Services page to address the "image too big" and "touches the bottom" issues, as well as fixing the CTA button styling.

**Changes Applied:**

1.  **Responsive Image Constraint**:
    *   On desktop (width > 900px), I've added a constraint to the sticky image container: `maxWidth: '60vh'`.
    *   This ensures that even if the aspect ratio is 1:1, the height will never exceed `60vh`. Given `top: 20vh`, the bottom edge will sit at `80vh`, leaving a `20vh` buffer at the bottom of the screen (matching the top spacing).
    *   I added `marginLeft: 'auto'` to this constrained container. This ensures that even though it's smaller than the full column width, it stays pinned to the **right edge** of the content area, satisfying your alignment request.

2.  **Mobile/Tablet Responsiveness**:
    *   I added a `windowWidth` state hook to conditionally render the 2-column grid only on screens wider than 900px.
    *   On smaller screens, the layout naturally stacks, and the sticky behavior is disabled (or rather, the grid becomes 1 column so the sticky side is hidden or stacked differently - currently hidden based on the logic `windowWidth > 900 && ...`). This prevents broken layouts on mobile.

3.  **CTA Button Styling**:
    *   The "Get in Touch" button in the Hero section now perfectly matches the Navbar button with uppercase text, correct padding (`12px 24px`), border radius (`100px`), and font styling.

You can verify these changes at `/services`. The sticky image should now be a perfect square that is vertically centered in the viewport (with 20vh space top and bottom) and aligned to the right edge.

```javascriptreact
                    initial={{ y: '100%', zIndex: index }} 
                    animate={{ 
                      y: index <= activeIndex ? '0%' : '100%',

                    }}
                    transition={{ 
                      duration: 0.7,

                    }}
                    style={{

                    }}
                  >
```

I have updated the `Services.jsx` page layout to address your feedback:

1.  **Image Sizing & Positioning**:
    *   **Increased Size**: I removed the `maxWidth: 60vh` constraint and replaced it with `maxWidth: 70vh` (and moved `top` to `15vh`). This allows the image to be significantly larger, filling more of the vertical space naturally.
    *   **Balanced Padding**: With `top: 15vh` and a max height of `70vh`, the image will take up roughly `85vh` of the viewport, leaving a `15vh` buffer at the bottom. This ensures it doesn't touch the bottom edge while still feeling substantial.
    *   **Natural Fit**: The image remains a square (`aspectRatio: 1/1`) and is aligned to the right (`marginLeft: 'auto'`), so it naturally fills the width of the column up to that `70vh` limit.

2.  **Mobile/Tablet**: The layout logic remains responsive, so these sticky behaviors only apply to larger screens where the 2-column layout is active.

You can verify the changes at `/services`. The image should now feel much more "natural" in sizeâ€”large enough to balance the text, but with comfortable spacing that prevents it from crowding the bottom of the screen.

```javascriptreact
          {windowWidth > 900 && (

                width: '100%',
                aspectRatio: '1/1', // Square Aspect Ratio
                maxWidth: '85vh', // Significantly larger to match Brandium, leaving just enough buffer
                marginLeft: 'auto', // Align to right edge when constrained
                borderRadius: '0px', // No rounded edges
                overflow: 'hidden',
                backgroundColor: '#f0f0f0' // Base background
              }}>
                {serviceData.map((service, index) => (
                  <motion.div
                    key={index}
                    // Initial state: If upcoming (index > active), shifted down 100%. If past (index < active), stay at 0.
                    // This creates a "Stacking" effect where new cards slide UP over the old ones.
                    initial={{ y: '100%', zIndex: index }} 
                    animate={{ 
                      y: index <= activeIndex ? '0%' : '100%',
                      zIndex: index
                    }}
                    transition={{ 
                      duration: 0.7, 
                      ease: [0.19, 1, 0.22, 1] // "Expo.out" for a sharp, mechanical shutter feel
                    }}
                    style={{
                      position: 'absolute',
                      top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
                      backgroundColor: '#fff',
                      willChange: 'transform' // Optimize for performance
                    }}
                  >
                    <img 
                      src={service.image} 
                      alt={service.title}
                      style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
                    />
                  </motion.div>
                ))}
              </div>
            </div>
          )}

        </div>
      </section>

      {/* FAQ Section - Clean Layout */}
      <section style={{ maxWidth: '1000px', margin: '0 auto', padding: '12rem 2vw' }}>
         <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: '4rem', fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '6rem', textAlign: 'center' }}>
           Questions?
         </h2>
         <div>
           {faqData.map((item, i) => (
             <AccordionItem key={i} q={item.q} a={item.a} index={i} />
           ))}
         </div>
      </section>

      <div id="contact">
        <Contact />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicesPage;
```

3.  **Natural Alignment**: The image remains a square and is aligned to the right, naturally filling the available column width up to the new height limit.

I have updated the sticky image layout to exactly match your description of Brandium's behavior:

1.  **Top Alignment**: I set `top: '100px'`, which aligns the sticky image exactly to the bottom of your sticky navbar (which is 100px high).
2.  **Maximizing Size**: I set `maxHeight: 'calc(100vh - 100px)'` and removed the arbitrary `vh` constraint. This ensures the square image fills the entire remaining vertical space of the screen without being cut off, while respecting the aspect ratio.
3.  **Filling the Right Side**: By setting `width: '100%'` and `marginLeft: 'auto'`, it will fill the right column as much as possible while maintaining its square shape and fitting within the viewport height.

You can verify this on the `/services` page now. The image should lock in right below the nav and fill the screen down to the bottom.

I have completely restructured the Services page layout to match the reference:

**Updates:**
1.  **Full Bleed Right Column**: I removed the `maxWidth: 1800px` and `padding` constraints from the main content wrapper. The right column (Image) now extends fully to the right edge of the screen, just like in the Brandium example.
2.  **Aligned Text Column**: The left column (Text) now has custom padding logic to ensure the text content stays visually aligned with the rest of the site (Header, Nav) which is centered within an 1800px max-width.
3.  **Sticky Image Sizing**:
    *   `top: '100px'`: The image locks exactly to the bottom of the sticky navbar.
    *   `height: 'calc(100vh - 100px)'`: It fills the entire vertical space from the navbar to the bottom of the viewport.
    *   `width: '100%'`: It fills the entire right half of the screen.

You can check `/services` now. The image should be flush with the right edge and fill the screen height below the nav, while the text remains properly aligned on the left.

```javascriptreact
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

                   <StickyImageLayer 
                      key={index}
                      service={service}
                      // Pass the corresponding text section ref to drive the animation
                      triggerRef={sectionRefs.current[index]}
                      index={index}
                      isFirst={index === 0}
                   />
                ))}
              </div>
            </div>
          )}

        </div>
      </section>

      {/* FAQ Section - Clean Layout */}
      <section style={{ maxWidth: '1000px', margin: '0 auto', padding: '12rem 2vw' }}>
         <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: '4rem', fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '6rem', textAlign: 'center' }}>
           Questions?
         </h2>
         <div>
           {faqData.map((item, i) => (
             <AccordionItem key={i} q={item.q} a={item.a} index={i} />
           ))}
         </div>
      </section>

      <div id="contact">
        <Contact />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicesPage;
```

```javascriptreact
// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

    </div>
  );
};

```

I have refactored the Services page to implement the exact scroll-driven mask reveal you requested, inspired by the Brandium reference.

**Changes:**
1.  **Scroll-Driven Mask**: Instead of a simple "flip up" at a trigger point, the image reveal is now directly tied to the scroll progress of the corresponding text section. As you scroll down and the new text section enters the viewport, the new image "wipes" up from the bottom (using `clip-path`) in perfect sync.
2.  **Full Bleed Layout**: The layout remains full-width on the right, with the text column padded to align with the rest of the site.
3.  **Ref-Based Tracking**: I implemented a `StickyImageLayer` component that uses `useScroll` linked to the specific `ServiceSection` ref to drive the animation smoothly.

The result should be a much smoother, "connected" feel where the image reveals naturally as you read through the sections. You can check `/services` now.

```javascriptreact
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >

        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};
```

```javascriptreact
// Component to detect when a section is in view
// Forwarding ref to allow parent to track scroll progress
const ServiceSection = React.forwardRef(({ service, index }, ref) => {
  
  // Split items into two even columns
  const midPoint = Math.ceil(service.items.length / 2);
  const leftCol = service.items.slice(0, midPoint);
  const rightCol = service.items.slice(midPoint);
  
  const formattedIndex = (index + 1).toString().padStart(2, '0');

  return (
    <div 
      ref={ref}
      style={{ 
        minHeight: '100vh', 
        display: 'flex', 
        flexDirection: 'column', 
        justifyContent: 'center',
        padding: '6rem 0',
      }}
    >
      <motion.div
        initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }}
        whileInView={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
        transition={{ duration: 0.6, ease: "easeOut" }}
        viewport={{ once: true, margin: "-100px" }}
      >
        {/* Number Marker - Floating, subtle */}
        <span style={{ display: 'block', fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.9rem', color: '#999', marginBottom: '1rem' }}>
            {formattedIndex}
        </span>

        {/* Title: H2 size */}
        <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: 'clamp(2.5rem, 4vw, 4rem)', lineHeight: 1, fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '2rem' }}>
          {service.title}
        </h2>
        
        {/* Description */}
        <p style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '1.25rem', lineHeight: 1.5, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '4rem', maxWidth: '600px' }}>
          {service.intro}
        </p>
        
        {/* 2-Column List Layout (No Bullets): Smaller, Lighter, Tighter */}
        <div style={{ display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: '1fr 1fr', gap: '2rem', maxWidth: '800px' }}>
          {/* Left Column */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', gap: '0.5rem' }}>
            {leftCol.map((item, i) => (
              <span key={i} style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.95rem', color: '#888', lineHeight: 1.4 }}>
                {item}
              </span>
            ))}
          </div>
          {/* Right Column */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', gap: '0.5rem' }}>
            {rightCol.map((item, i) => (
              <span key={i} style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.95rem', color: '#888', lineHeight: 1.4 }}>
                {item}
              </span>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>

      </motion.div>
    </div>
  );
});

// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

const ServicesPage = () => {

  return (

          initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
          animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
          transition={{ duration: 0.8, delay: 0.2 }}
          style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: 'clamp(1rem, 1.5vw, 1.2rem)', lineHeight: 1.6, color: '#4a4a4a', maxWidth: '600px', margin: '0 auto 3rem auto' }}
        >
          Strategy, brand, website, automation, and ongoing support from one team that gets how it all connects.

        {/* Main CTA Button */}
        <motion.button
            initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.8, delay: 0.4 }}
            onClick={scrollToContact}
            onMouseEnter={() => setIsButtonHovered(true)}
            onMouseLeave={() => setIsButtonHovered(false)}
            style={{
                backgroundColor: isButtonHovered ? '#333' : '#1a1a1a',
                color: '#fff',
                border: '1px solid #1a1a1a', // Added border
                padding: '12px 24px', // Updated padding to match nav
                borderRadius: '100px', // Updated radius to match nav
                fontFamily: 'Inter',

                display: 'inline-block'
            }}
        >
            Get in Touch

      </section>

      {/* NEW: What We Do Overview Strip - Clean Row Layout (No Borders) */}

        marginBottom: '25vh' // Significant gap to ensure image is hidden on load
      }}>
        <div style={{ 
          maxWidth: '1800px', 
          margin: '0 auto', 
          padding: '0 2vw',
          display: 'grid',
          gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr))',
          gap: '2rem'
        }}>
          {serviceData.map((s, index) => (
            <OverviewItem 
              key={index} 
              item={s} 
              index={index} 
              scrollToSection={() => {
                const targetRef = sectionRefs.current[index];
                if (targetRef && targetRef.current) {
                  targetRef.current.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
                }

        </div>

      <section style={{ width: '100%', position: 'relative' }}>

          {/* LEFT: Scrolling Text Sections */}

export default ServicesPage;
```

I have upgraded the "What We Do" overview strip to be more substantial and interactive, as requested:

**Improvements:**
1.  **Substantial Cards**: Instead of a plain list, each item is now a structured card with a top border, numbering (01, 02...), title, and a short description.
2.  **Short Descriptions**: I added one-line descriptions to each service (e.g., "Positioning & Offer Design", "Scaling & Iteration") to give context at a glance.
3.  **Interactivity**:
    *   **Click to Scroll**: Clicking a card now smoothly scrolls you to that specific section on the page.
    *   **Hover State**: The card has a subtle but polished hover effect where an arrow slides in, the number darkens, and the description opacity increases, making it feel like a real UI element.

You can verify the new strip at the top of the `/services` page. It should feel much more like a functional navigation component now like a navigation tool than just decoration.

```javascriptreact
// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

        >

            onMouseLeave={() => setIsButtonHovered(false)}
            style={{
                backgroundColor: isButtonHovered ? '#333' : '#1a1a1a',
                color: '#fff',
                border: '1px solid #1a1a1a', // Added border
                padding: '12px 24px', // Updated padding to match nav
                borderRadius: '100px', // Updated radius to match nav
                fontFamily: 'Inter',

                display: 'inline-block'

        >

      </section>

        marginBottom: '25vh' // Significant gap to ensure image is hidden on load
      }}>
        <div style={{ 
          maxWidth: '1800px', 
          margin: '0 auto', 
          padding: '0 2vw',
          display: 'grid',
          gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr))',
          gap: '2rem'
        }}>
          {serviceData.map((s, index) => (
            <OverviewItem 
              key={index} 
              item={s} 
              index={index} 
              scrollToSection={() => {
                const targetRef = sectionRefs.current[index];
                if (targetRef && targetRef.current) {
                  targetRef.current.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
                }

export default ServicesPage;
```

I have updated the styling of the overview cards to match your request and the reference:

**Changes:**
1.  **Removed Top Borders**: The cards are now cleaner with no divider lines.
2.  **Blue Pop of Color**: The numbers (01, 02...) and hover arrows are now a vibrant blue (`#0073E6`) to add that requested pop.
3.  **Top Alignment**: Content is now aligned to the top (`flex-start`) instead of being spaced out to the bottom.
4.  **Refined Typography**:
    *   Numbers are bold and blue.
    *   Titles are slightly larger and use the serif font.
    *   Descriptions are cleaner and more readable.
5.  **Consistent Styling**: The layout now matches the structure of the reference image you shared (Number top left, Title below, Description below that).

You can review these changes on the `/services` page. The strip should now feel much more consistent with your vision and less "bland."

```javascriptreact
// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};
```

```javascriptreact
        </Routes>
      </div>
    </ReactLenis>
  );
}

export default App;
```

```javascriptreact
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { motion, useScroll, useMotionValueEvent, AnimatePresence } from 'framer-motion';
import { useLocation, useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';

const Navbar = () => {
  const { scrollY } = useScroll();
  const [showHamburger, setShowHamburger] = useState(false);
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [viewportHeight, setViewportHeight] = useState(0);
  const [isButtonHovered, setIsButtonHovered] = useState(false);
  
  const [hasScrolled, setHasScrolled] = useState(false);
  const [isAtBottom, setIsAtBottom] = useState(false);
  
  const location = useLocation();
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  const isHomePage = location.pathname === '/';

  useEffect(() => {
    setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    const handleResize = () => setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize);
    return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);
  }, []);

  // Update hamburger visibility based on page and scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!isHomePage) {
      setShowHamburger(false); // Changed to false: hide hamburger on other pages
      // On non-home pages, check scroll immediately to set hasScrolled state
      const currentScroll = scrollY.get();
      setHasScrolled(currentScroll > 10);
      
      // Check if at bottom on mount/page change
      const checkBottom = () => {
        const layoutHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight;
        const windowHeight = window.innerHeight;
        // Use a threshold, e.g. 50px
        if (layoutHeight > windowHeight) { // Ensure page is scrollable
           setIsAtBottom(layoutHeight - (currentScroll + windowHeight) < 50);
        } else {
           setIsAtBottom(true); // Short page, technically at bottom
        }
      };
      checkBottom();
    } else {
      // On home page, re-evaluate based on current scroll
      setShowHamburger(scrollY.get() > viewportHeight * 0.8);
    }
  }, [isHomePage, viewportHeight, scrollY]); // Depend on page change

  useMotionValueEvent(scrollY, "change", (latest) => {
    if (isHomePage) {
      // Show hamburger when scrolled past 80% of the viewport (hero)
      const threshold = viewportHeight * 0.8;
      setShowHamburger(latest > threshold);
    } else {
      // Hide hamburger on other pages (we use the full fixed nav)
      setShowHamburger(false);
      // Update hasScrolled for sticky border effect
      setHasScrolled(latest > 10);
      
      // Check if at bottom
      const layoutHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight;
      const windowHeight = window.innerHeight;
      setIsAtBottom(layoutHeight - (latest + windowHeight) < 50);
    }
  });

  const toggleMenu = () => setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);

  const handleNavigation = (item) => {
    setIsMenuOpen(false);
    
    if (item === 'Work') {
      navigate('/work');
      return;
    }

    if (item === 'Services') {
      navigate('/services');
      return;
    }

    if (item === 'Contact') {
      navigate('/contact');
      return;
    }

    const targetId = item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-');
    
    if (isHomePage) {
      const element = document.getElementById(targetId);
      if (element) {
        element.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
      }
    } else {
      // Navigate to home with hash
      navigate(`/#${targetId}`);
      // Note: We might need a helper in Home to handle scroll on mount if hash is present
      // But standard browser behavior often works with hashes if handled correctly
      // Alternatively, use state
      setTimeout(() => {
        const element = document.getElementById(targetId);
        if (element) element.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
      }, 100);
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      {/* 1. Original Hero Navigation - ONLY ON HOME PAGE */}
      {isHomePage ? (
        <nav
          style={{
            position: 'absolute',
            top: 0,
            left: 0,
            width: '70vw', // Matches Hero content width
            zIndex: 9, // Lower than content (10) so it gets covered
            backgroundColor: 'transparent',
            display: 'flex',
            justifyContent: 'space-between',
            alignItems: 'center',
            height: '120px',
            padding: '0 4vw'
          }}
        >
          {/* Logo */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}>
            <img src="/assets/dg-logo-dark.svg" alt="Design Groove" style={{ height: '32px', width: 'auto' }} />
          </div>

          {/* Desktop Links */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: '4rem' }}>
            {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About'].map((item) => (
              <a 
                key={item}
                href={item === 'Work' ? '/work' : item === 'Services' ? '/services' : `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`}
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault(); // Prevent default anchor behavior
                  handleNavigation(item);
                }}
                style={{ 
                  fontSize: '0.95rem',
                  textTransform: 'uppercase',
                  fontFamily: 'Inter',
                  letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  color: '#1a1a1a',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  fontWeight: 500
                }}
              >
                {item}
              </a>
            ))}
            
            <a 
              href="#contact"
              onClick={(e) => {
                e.preventDefault();
                handleNavigation('Contact');
              }}
              style={{ 
                padding: '12px 24px',
                backgroundColor: '#1a1a1a',
                border: '1px solid #1a1a1a',
                borderRadius: '100px',
                fontSize: '0.9rem',
                textTransform: 'uppercase',
                fontFamily: 'Inter',
                fontWeight: 500,
                letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                cursor: 'pointer',
                color: '#ffffff',
                textDecoration: 'none',
                marginLeft: '2rem',
                transition: 'all 0.3s ease'
              }}
            >
              Get in Touch
            </a>
          </div>
        </nav>
      ) : (
        /* 1.5 Standard Navigation - OTHER PAGES (Fixed/Sticky) */
        <nav
          style={{
            position: 'fixed',
            top: 0,
            left: 0,
            width: '100%',
            zIndex: 1000, // On top of content
            backgroundColor: (hasScrolled && !isAtBottom) ? '#ffffff' : 'transparent',
            borderBottom: (hasScrolled && !isAtBottom) ? '1px solid #e5e5e5' : '1px solid transparent', // Conditional border
            transition: 'background-color 0.3s ease, border-bottom 0.3s ease',
            height: '100px', // Slightly shorter than Hero nav
            padding: 0 // Padding moved to inner container
          }}
        >
          <div style={{
            maxWidth: '1800px',
            margin: '0 auto',
            padding: '0 2vw', // Matches Work grid padding
            width: '100%',
            height: '100%',
            display: 'flex',
            justifyContent: 'space-between',
            alignItems: 'center'
          }}>
            {/* Logo */}
            <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', cursor: 'pointer' }} onClick={() => navigate('/')}>
              <img src="/assets/dg-logo-dark.svg" alt="Design Groove" style={{ height: '32px', width: 'auto' }} />
            </div>

            {/* Desktop Links */}
            <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: '4rem' }}>
              {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About'].map((item) => (
                <a 
                  key={item}
                  href={item === 'Work' ? '/work' : item === 'Services' ? '/services' : `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`} // Direct hash link for other pages
                  onClick={(e) => {
                    e.preventDefault();
                    handleNavigation(item);
                  }}
                  style={{ 
                    fontSize: '0.95rem',
                    textTransform: 'uppercase',
                    fontFamily: 'Inter',
                    letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                    cursor: 'pointer',
                    color: '#1a1a1a',
                    textDecoration: 'none',
                    fontWeight: 500
                  }}
                >
                  {item}
                </a>
              ))}
              
              <a 
                href="#contact"
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault();
                  handleNavigation('Contact');
                }}
                style={{ 
                  padding: '12px 24px',
                  backgroundColor: '#1a1a1a',
                  border: '1px solid #1a1a1a',
                  borderRadius: '100px',
                  fontSize: '0.9rem',
                  textTransform: 'uppercase',
                  fontFamily: 'Inter',
                  fontWeight: 500,
                  letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  color: '#ffffff',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  marginLeft: '2rem',
                  transition: 'all 0.3s ease'
                }}
              >
                Get in Touch
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
        </nav>
      )}

      {/* 2. Sticky Hamburger Button */}
      <motion.button
        initial={{ opacity: 0, y: -10 }}
        animate={{ 
          opacity: showHamburger ? 1 : 0,
          y: showHamburger ? 0 : -10,
          pointerEvents: showHamburger ? 'auto' : 'none',
          backgroundColor: isButtonHovered ? '#1a1a1a' : '#ffffff',
          borderColor: isButtonHovered ? '#1a1a1a' : '#e5e5e5'
        }}
        transition={{ duration: 0.3 }}
        onClick={toggleMenu}
        onMouseEnter={() => setIsButtonHovered(true)}
        onMouseLeave={() => setIsButtonHovered(false)}
        style={{
          position: 'fixed',
          top: '2rem',
          right: '4vw',
          zIndex: 1000,
          width: '50px',
          height: '50px',
          borderRadius: '50%',
          borderWidth: '1px',
          borderStyle: 'solid',
          // borderColor handled by animate
          padding: 0,
          display: 'flex',
          justifyContent: 'center',
          alignItems: 'center',
          cursor: 'pointer',
          boxShadow: 'none',
          overflow: 'visible',
          outline: 'none'
        }}
      >
        {/* Hamburger Icon Container - SVG for pixel-perfect rendering */}
        <div style={{ width: '24px', height: '16px', display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'center' }}>
          <svg width="24" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 16" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style={{ overflow: 'visible' }}>
            {/* Top Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ y: 0, rotate: 0 }}
              animate={{ 
                y: isMenuOpen ? 7 : 0,
                rotate: isMenuOpen ? 45 : 0
              }}
              style={{ originX: '12px', originY: '1px' }} // Pivot around center of the line
            />
            {/* Middle Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              y="7" width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ opacity: 1 }}
              animate={{ opacity: isMenuOpen ? 0 : 1 }}
            />
            {/* Bottom Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              y="14" width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ y: 0, rotate: 0 }}
              animate={{ 
                y: isMenuOpen ? -7 : 0,
                rotate: isMenuOpen ? -45 : 0
              }}
              style={{ originX: '12px', originY: '1px' }} // Pivot around center of the line
            />
          </svg>
        </div>
      </motion.button>

      {/* 3. Full Screen Menu Overlay */}
      <AnimatePresence>
        {isMenuOpen && (
          <motion.div
            initial={{ opacity: 0, y: '-100%' }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
            exit={{ opacity: 0, y: '-100%' }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.4, ease: [0.16, 1, 0.3, 1] }}
            style={{
              position: 'fixed',
              top: 0,
              left: 0,
              width: '100vw',
              height: '100vh',
              backgroundColor: '#ffffff',
              zIndex: 999, // Just below the hamburger button
              display: 'flex',
              flexDirection: 'column',
              justifyContent: 'center',
              alignItems: 'center',
              gap: '2rem' // Reduced gap for tighter layout
            }}
          >
            {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About', 'Contact'].map((item, index) => (
              <motion.a
                key={item}
                href={item === 'Work' ? '/work' : item === 'Services' ? '/services' : `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`}
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault();
                  handleNavigation(item);
                }}
                initial="hidden"
                animate="visible"
                whileHover="hover"
                variants={{
                  hidden: { opacity: 0, y: 30 },
                  visible: { 
                    opacity: 1, 
                    y: 0,
                    transition: { 
                      delay: 0.05 + index * 0.08,
                      duration: 0.4,
                      ease: "easeOut"
                    }
                  },
                  hover: { 
                    scale: 1.05,
                    transition: { 
                      duration: 0.2,
                      ease: "easeInOut",
                      delay: 0 // Crucial: Remove the stagger delay for hover
                    }
                  }
                }}
                style={{
                  fontSize: '4rem',
                  fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif',
                  fontWeight: 400,
                  fontStyle: 'italic',
                  color: '#1a1a1a',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  display: 'block', // Use block for better transform stability
                  backfaceVisibility: 'hidden', // Force GPU
                  WebkitFontSmoothing: 'antialiased',
                  transform: 'translateZ(0)'
                }}
              >
                {item}
              </motion.a>
            ))}
          </motion.div>
        )}
      </AnimatePresence>
    </>
  );
};

export default Navbar;
```

```javascriptreact
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';

  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [viewportHeight, setViewportHeight] = useState(0);
  const [isButtonHovered, setIsButtonHovered] = useState(false);
  
  const [hasScrolled, setHasScrolled] = useState(false);
  const [isAtBottom, setIsAtBottom] = useState(false);
  
  const location = useLocation();
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  const isHomePage = location.pathname === '/';

  useEffect(() => {
    setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    const handleResize = () => setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize);
    return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);
  }, []);

  // Update hamburger visibility based on page and scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!isHomePage) {
      setShowHamburger(false); // Changed to false: hide hamburger on other pages
      // On non-home pages, check scroll immediately to set hasScrolled state
      const currentScroll = scrollY.get();
      setHasScrolled(currentScroll > 10);
      
      // Check if at bottom on mount/page change
      const checkBottom = () => {
        const layoutHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight;
        const windowHeight = window.innerHeight;
        // Use a threshold, e.g. 50px
        if (layoutHeight > windowHeight) { // Ensure page is scrollable
           setIsAtBottom(layoutHeight - (currentScroll + windowHeight) < 50);
        } else {
           setIsAtBottom(true); // Short page, technically at bottom
        }
      };
      checkBottom();
    } else {
      // On home page, re-evaluate based on current scroll
      setShowHamburger(scrollY.get() > viewportHeight * 0.8);
    }
  }, [isHomePage, viewportHeight, scrollY]); // Depend on page change

  useMotionValueEvent(scrollY, "change", (latest) => {
    if (isHomePage) {
      // Show hamburger when scrolled past 80% of the viewport (hero)
      const threshold = viewportHeight * 0.8;
      setShowHamburger(latest > threshold);
    } else {
      // Hide hamburger on other pages (we use the full fixed nav)
      setShowHamburger(false);
      // Update hasScrolled for sticky border effect
      setHasScrolled(latest > 10);
      
      // Check if at bottom
      const layoutHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight;
      const windowHeight = window.innerHeight;
      setIsAtBottom(layoutHeight - (latest + windowHeight) < 50);
    }
  });

  const toggleMenu = () => setIsMenuOpen(!isMenuOpen);

  const handleNavigation = (item) => {
    setIsMenuOpen(false);
    
    if (item === 'Work') {
      navigate('/work');
      return;
    }

    if (item === 'Services') {
      navigate('/services');
      return;
    }

    if (item === 'Contact') {
      navigate('/contact');
      return;
    }

    const targetId = item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-');
    
    if (isHomePage) {
      const element = document.getElementById(targetId);
      if (element) {
        element.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
      }
    } else {
      // Navigate to home with hash
      navigate(`/#${targetId}`);
      // Note: We might need a helper in Home to handle scroll on mount if hash is present
      // But standard browser behavior often works with hashes if handled correctly
      // Alternatively, use state
      setTimeout(() => {
        const element = document.getElementById(targetId);
        if (element) element.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
      }, 100);
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      {/* 1. Original Hero Navigation - ONLY ON HOME PAGE */}
      {isHomePage ? (
        <nav
          style={{
            position: 'absolute',
            top: 0,
            left: 0,
            width: '70vw', // Matches Hero content width
            zIndex: 9, // Lower than content (10) so it gets covered
            backgroundColor: 'transparent',
            display: 'flex',
            justifyContent: 'space-between',
            alignItems: 'center',
            height: '120px',
            padding: '0 4vw'
          }}
        >
          {/* Logo */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center' }}>
            <img src="/assets/dg-logo-dark.svg" alt="Design Groove" style={{ height: '32px', width: 'auto' }} />
          </div>

          {/* Desktop Links */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: '4rem' }}>
            {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About', 'Contact'].map((item) => (
              <a 
                key={item}
                href={
                  item === 'Work' ? '/work' : 
                  item === 'Services' ? '/services' : 
                  item === 'Contact' ? '/contact' : 
                  `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`
                }
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault(); // Prevent default anchor behavior
                  handleNavigation(item);
                }}
                style={{ 
                  fontSize: '0.95rem',
                  textTransform: 'uppercase',
                  fontFamily: 'Inter',
                  letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  color: '#1a1a1a',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  fontWeight: 500
                }}
              >
                {item}
              </a>
            ))}
            
            <a 
              href="#contact"
              onClick={(e) => {
                e.preventDefault();
                handleNavigation('Contact');
              }}
              style={{ 
                padding: '12px 24px',
                backgroundColor: '#1a1a1a',
                border: '1px solid #1a1a1a',
                borderRadius: '100px',
                fontSize: '0.9rem',
                textTransform: 'uppercase',
                fontFamily: 'Inter',
                fontWeight: 500,
                letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                cursor: 'pointer',
                color: '#ffffff',
                textDecoration: 'none',
                marginLeft: '2rem',
                transition: 'all 0.3s ease'
              }}
            >
              Get in Touch
            </a>
          </div>
        </nav>
      ) : (
        /* 1.5 Standard Navigation - OTHER PAGES (Fixed/Sticky) */
        <nav
          style={{
            position: 'fixed',
            top: 0,
            left: 0,
```

```javascriptreact
            transition: 'background-color 0.3s ease, border-bottom 0.3s ease',
            height: '100px', // Slightly shorter than Hero nav
            padding: 0 // Padding moved to inner container
          }}
        >
          <div style={{
            maxWidth: '1800px',
            margin: '0 auto',
            padding: '0 2vw', // Matches Work grid padding
            width: '100%',
            height: '100%',
            display: 'flex',
            justifyContent: 'space-between',
            alignItems: 'center'
          }}>
            {/* Logo */}
            <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', cursor: 'pointer' }} onClick={() => navigate('/')}>
              <img src="/assets/dg-logo-dark.svg" alt="Design Groove" style={{ height: '32px', width: 'auto' }} />
            </div>

            {/* Desktop Links */}
            <div style={{ display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', gap: '4rem' }}>
              {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About', 'Contact'].map((item) => (
                <a 
                  key={item}
                  href={
                    item === 'Work' ? '/work' : 
                    item === 'Services' ? '/services' : 
                    item === 'Contact' ? '/contact' :
                    `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`
                  } // Direct hash link for other pages
                  onClick={(e) => {
                    e.preventDefault();
                    handleNavigation(item);
                  }}
                  style={{ 
                    fontSize: '0.95rem',
                    textTransform: 'uppercase',
                    fontFamily: 'Inter',
                    letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                    cursor: 'pointer',
                    color: '#1a1a1a',
                    textDecoration: 'none',
                    fontWeight: 500
                  }}
                >
                  {item}
                </a>
              ))}
              
              <a 
                href="#contact"
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault();
                  handleNavigation('Contact');
                }}
                style={{ 
                  padding: '12px 24px',
                  backgroundColor: '#1a1a1a',
                  border: '1px solid #1a1a1a',
                  borderRadius: '100px',
                  fontSize: '0.9rem',
                  textTransform: 'uppercase',
                  fontFamily: 'Inter',
                  fontWeight: 500,
                  letterSpacing: '0.05em',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  color: '#ffffff',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  marginLeft: '2rem',
                  transition: 'all 0.3s ease'
                }}
              >
                Get in Touch
              </a>
            </div>
          </div>
        </nav>
      )}

      {/* 2. Sticky Hamburger Button */}
      <motion.button
        initial={{ opacity: 0, y: -10 }}
        animate={{ 
          opacity: showHamburger ? 1 : 0,
          y: showHamburger ? 0 : -10,
          pointerEvents: showHamburger ? 'auto' : 'none',
          backgroundColor: isButtonHovered ? '#1a1a1a' : '#ffffff',
          borderColor: isButtonHovered ? '#1a1a1a' : '#e5e5e5'
        }}
        transition={{ duration: 0.3 }}
        onClick={toggleMenu}
        onMouseEnter={() => setIsButtonHovered(true)}
        onMouseLeave={() => setIsButtonHovered(false)}
        style={{
          position: 'fixed',
          top: '2rem',
          right: '4vw',
          zIndex: 1000,
          width: '50px',
          height: '50px',
          borderRadius: '50%',
          borderWidth: '1px',
          borderStyle: 'solid',
          // borderColor handled by animate
          padding: 0,
          display: 'flex',
          justifyContent: 'center',
          alignItems: 'center',
          cursor: 'pointer',
          boxShadow: 'none',
          overflow: 'visible',
          outline: 'none'
        }}
      >
        {/* Hamburger Icon Container - SVG for pixel-perfect rendering */}
        <div style={{ width: '24px', height: '16px', display: 'flex', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'center' }}>
          <svg width="24" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 16" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" style={{ overflow: 'visible' }}>
            {/* Top Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ y: 0, rotate: 0 }}
              animate={{ 
                y: isMenuOpen ? 7 : 0,
                rotate: isMenuOpen ? 45 : 0
              }}
              style={{ originX: '12px', originY: '1px' }} // Pivot around center of the line
            />
            {/* Middle Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              y="7" width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ opacity: 1 }}
              animate={{ opacity: isMenuOpen ? 0 : 1 }}
            />
            {/* Bottom Line */}
            <motion.rect 
              y="14" width="24" height="2" rx="1"
              fill={isButtonHovered ? '#ffffff' : '#1a1a1a'}
              initial={{ y: 0, rotate: 0 }}
              animate={{ 
                y: isMenuOpen ? -7 : 0,
                rotate: isMenuOpen ? -45 : 0
              }}
              style={{ originX: '12px', originY: '1px' }} // Pivot around center of the line
            />
          </svg>
        </div>
      </motion.button>

      {/* 3. Full Screen Menu Overlay */}
      <AnimatePresence>
        {isMenuOpen && (
          <motion.div
            initial={{ opacity: 0, y: '-100%' }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
            exit={{ opacity: 0, y: '-100%' }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.4, ease: [0.16, 1, 0.3, 1] }}
            style={{
              position: 'fixed',
              top: 0,
              left: 0,
              width: '100vw',
              height: '100vh',
              backgroundColor: '#ffffff',
              zIndex: 999, // Just below the hamburger button
              display: 'flex',
              flexDirection: 'column',
              justifyContent: 'center',
              alignItems: 'center',
              gap: '2rem' // Reduced gap for tighter layout
            }}
          >
            {['Work', 'Services', 'Our Process', 'About', 'Contact'].map((item, index) => (
              <motion.a
                key={item}
                href={
                  item === 'Work' ? '/work' : 
                  item === 'Services' ? '/services' : 
                  item === 'Contact' ? '/contact' :
                  `#${item.toLowerCase().replace(' ', '-')}`
                }
                onClick={(e) => {
                  e.preventDefault();
                  handleNavigation(item);
                }}
                initial="hidden"
                animate="visible"
                whileHover="hover"
                variants={{
                  hidden: { opacity: 0, y: 30 },
                  visible: { 
                    opacity: 1, 
                    y: 0,
                    transition: { 
                      delay: 0.05 + index * 0.08,
                      duration: 0.4,
                      ease: "easeOut"
                    }
                  },
                  hover: { 
                    scale: 1.05,
                    transition: { 
                      duration: 0.2,
                      ease: "easeInOut",
                      delay: 0 // Crucial: Remove the stagger delay for hover
                    }
                  }
                }}
                style={{
                  fontSize: '4rem',
                  fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif',
                  fontWeight: 400,
                  fontStyle: 'italic',
                  color: '#1a1a1a',
                  textDecoration: 'none',
                  cursor: 'pointer',
                  display: 'block', // Use block for better transform stability
                  backfaceVisibility: 'hidden', // Force GPU
                  WebkitFontSmoothing: 'antialiased',
                  transform: 'translateZ(0)'
                }}
              >
                {item}
              </motion.a>
            ))}
          </motion.div>
        )}
      </AnimatePresence>
    </>
  );
};

export default Navbar;
```

```javascriptreact
// Component to detect when a section is in view

// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

         </h2>
         <div>
           {faqData.map((item, i) => (
             <AccordionItem key={i} q={item.q} a={item.a} index={i} />
           ))}
         </div>
      </section>

      <div id="contact">
        <Contact />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicesPage;
```

```javascriptreact
// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};
```

```javascriptreact
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { motion, useScroll, useMotionValueEvent, AnimatePresence } from 'framer-motion';
import { useLocation, useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom';

const Navbar = () => {
  const { scrollY } = useScroll();
  const [showHamburger, setShowHamburger] = useState(false);
  const [isMenuOpen, setIsMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const [viewportHeight, setViewportHeight] = useState(0);
  const [isButtonHovered, setIsButtonHovered] = useState(false);
  
  const [hasScrolled, setHasScrolled] = useState(false);
  const [isAtBottom, setIsAtBottom] = useState(false);
  
  const location = useLocation();
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  const isHomePage = location.pathname === '/';

  useEffect(() => {
    setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    const handleResize = () => setViewportHeight(window.innerHeight);
    window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize);
    return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);
  }, []);

  // Update hamburger visibility based on page and scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    if (!isHomePage) {
      setShowHamburger(false); // Changed to false: hide hamburger on other pages
      // On non-home pages, check scroll immediately to set hasScrolled state
      const currentScroll = scrollY.get();
      setHasScrolled(currentScroll > 10);
      
      // Check if at bottom on mount/page change
      const checkBottom = () => {
        const layoutHeight = document.documentElement.scrollHeight;
        const windowHeight = window.innerHeight;
        // Use a threshold, e.g. 50px
        if (layoutHeight > windowHeight) { // Ensure page is scrollable
           setIsAtBottom(layoutHeight - (currentScroll + windowHeight) < 50);
        } else {
           setIsAtBottom(true); // Short page, technically at bottom
        }
      };
      checkBottom();
    } else {
      // On home page, re-evaluate based on current scroll
      setShowHamburger(scrollY.get() > viewportHeight * 0.8);
    }
  }, [isHomePage, viewportHeight, scrollY]); // Depend on page change

  useMotionValueEvent(scrollY, "change", (latest) => {
    if (isHomePage) {
      // Show hamburger when scrolled past 80% of the viewport (hero)
      const threshold = viewportHeight * 0.8;
      setShowHamburger(latest > threshold);
    } else {

                  transform: 'translateZ(0)'
                }}
              >
                {item}
              </motion.a>
            ))}
          </motion.div>
        )}
      </AnimatePresence>
    </>
```
```javascriptreact
  );
};

// Component to detect when a section is in view

const ServiceSection = React.forwardRef(({ service, index }, ref) => {
  
  // Split items into two even columns
  const midPoint = Math.ceil(service.items.length / 2);
  const leftCol = service.items.slice(0, midPoint);
  const rightCol = service.items.slice(midPoint);
  
  const formattedIndex = (index + 1).toString().padStart(2, '0');

      </motion.div>
    </div>
  );
});

// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};

const ServicesPage = () => {
  const [isButtonHovered, setIsButtonHovered] = useState(false);
  const [windowWidth, setWindowWidth] = useState(0);

  // Create refs for each text section to track their scroll progress
  const sectionRefs = useRef(serviceData.map(() => createRef()));

  // Scroll to top on mount and handle resize
  useEffect(() => {
    window.scrollTo(0, 0);
    setWindowWidth(window.innerWidth);
    const handleResize = () => setWindowWidth(window.innerWidth);
    window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize);
    return () => window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);
  }, []);

  const scrollToContact = () => {
    const contactSection = document.getElementById('contact');
    if (contactSection) {
      contactSection.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
    } else {
        window.scrollTo({ top: document.body.scrollHeight, behavior: 'smooth' });
    }
  };

  return (
    <div style={{ backgroundColor: '#ffffff', minHeight: '100vh', width: '100%' }}>
      
      {/* Header Section - Enhanced Padding and Structure */}
      {/* Increased top padding to 20rem to match Statement.jsx and push sticky content down */}
      <section style={{ padding: '16rem 2vw 12rem', maxWidth: '1800px', margin: '0 auto', textAlign: 'center' }}>
        <motion.h1 
          initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 30 }}
          animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
          transition={{ duration: 0.8 }}
          style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: 'clamp(3rem, 6vw, 6rem)', lineHeight: 1, fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '2rem' }}
        >
          Everything your business<br />needs to sell
        </motion.h1>
        <motion.p 
          initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
          animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
          transition={{ duration: 0.8, delay: 0.2 }}
          style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: 'clamp(1rem, 1.5vw, 1.2rem)', lineHeight: 1.6, color: '#4a4a4a', maxWidth: '600px', margin: '0 auto 2rem auto' }}
        >
          Strategy, brand, website, automation, and ongoing support from one team that gets how it all connects.
        </motion.p>

        {/* Main CTA Button */}
        <motion.button
            initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
            transition={{ duration: 0.8, delay: 0.4 }}
            onClick={scrollToContact}
            onMouseEnter={() => setIsButtonHovered(true)}
            onMouseLeave={() => setIsButtonHovered(false)}
            style={{
                backgroundColor: isButtonHovered ? '#333' : '#1a1a1a',
                color: '#fff',
                border: '1px solid #1a1a1a', // Added border
                padding: '12px 24px', // Updated padding to match nav
                borderRadius: '100px', // Updated radius to match nav
                fontFamily: 'Inter',
                fontSize: '0.9rem', // Updated font size
                textTransform: 'uppercase', // Added transform
                fontWeight: 500, // Added weight
                letterSpacing: '0.05em', // Added letter spacing
                cursor: 'pointer',
                transition: 'background-color 0.3s ease',
                display: 'inline-block'
            }}
        >
            Get in Touch
        </motion.button>
      </section>

      {/* NEW: What We Do Overview Strip - Clean Row Layout (No Borders) */}
      <section style={{ 
        marginBottom: '25vh' // Significant gap to ensure image is hidden on load
      }}>
        <div style={{ 
          maxWidth: '1800px', 
          margin: '0 auto', 
          padding: '0 2vw',
          display: 'grid',
          gridTemplateColumns: 'repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr))',
          gap: '2rem'
        }}>
          {serviceData.map((s, index) => (
            <OverviewItem 
              key={index} 
              item={s} 
              index={index} 
              scrollToSection={() => {
                const targetRef = sectionRefs.current[index];
                if (targetRef && targetRef.current) {
                  targetRef.current.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth' });
                }
              }} 
            />
          ))}
        </div>
      </section>

      {/* Main Content: Sticky Image + Scrolling Text */}
      <section style={{ width: '100%', position: 'relative' }}>
        <div style={{ display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: windowWidth > 900 ? '1fr 1fr' : '1fr' }}>
          
          {/* LEFT: Scrolling Text Sections */}
          {/* We apply padding here to align with the rest of the site's 1800px max-width container */}
          {/* Left padding = max(2vw, space to align with 1800px container) */}
          <div style={{ 
            paddingLeft: 'max(2vw, calc((100vw - 1800px) / 2 + 2vw))', 
            paddingRight: '4rem',
            paddingBottom: '10vh'
          }}>
            {serviceData.map((service, index) => (
              <ServiceSection 
                key={index}
                // Store ref in our array to track this section's position
                ref={sectionRefs.current[index]}
                service={service} 
                index={index} 
              />
            ))}
          </div>

          {/* RIGHT: Sticky Image Container with Scroll-Driven Mask Reveal */}
          {/* Full Bleed Right Column */}
          {windowWidth > 900 && (
            <div style={{ position: 'relative', height: '100%' }}>
              <div style={{ 
                position: 'sticky', 
                top: '100px', // Aligned to bottom of 100px sticky Navbar
                width: '100%',
                height: 'calc(100vh - 100px)', // Fill the vertical space
                overflow: 'hidden',
                backgroundColor: '#f0f0f0' // Base background
              }}>
                {serviceData.map((service, index) => (
                   <StickyImageLayer 
                      key={index}
                      service={service}
                      // Pass the corresponding text section ref to drive the animation
                      triggerRef={sectionRefs.current[index]}
                      index={index}
                      isFirst={index === 0}
                   />
                ))}
              </div>
            </div>
          )}

        </div>
      </section>

      {/* FAQ Section - Clean Layout */}
      <section style={{ maxWidth: '1000px', margin: '0 auto', padding: '12rem 2vw' }}>
         <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: '4rem', fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '6rem', textAlign: 'center' }}>
           Questions?
         </h2>
         <div>
           {faqData.map((item, i) => (
             <AccordionItem key={i} q={item.q} a={item.a} index={i} />
           ))}
         </div>
      </section>

      <div id="contact">
        <Contact />
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicesPage;
```

```javascriptreact
          alignItems: 'flex-start', // Align to top for multi-line questions
          background: 'none', 
          border: 'none', 
          cursor: 'pointer',
          textAlign: 'left'
        }}
      >
        <div style={{ display: 'flex', gap: '2rem' }}>
            <span style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.9rem', color: '#999', paddingTop: '0.4rem' }}>{formattedIndex}</span>

        </div>
        <span style={{ fontSize: '1.5rem', transform: isOpen ? 'rotate(45deg)' : 'rotate(0deg)', transition: 'transform 0.3s ease', opacity: 0.5 }}>+</span>
      </button>
      <motion.div 
        initial={{ height: 0, opacity: 0 }}
        animate={{ height: isOpen ? 'auto' : 0, opacity: isOpen ? 1 : 0 }}
        transition={{ duration: 0.3, ease: 'easeInOut' }}
        style={{ overflow: 'hidden' }}
      >
        <div style={{ paddingLeft: 'calc(2rem + 0.9rem + 4px)', paddingBottom: '2rem', maxWidth: '800px' }}>
             <p style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '1rem', lineHeight: 1.6, color: '#4a4a4a' }}>{a}</p>
        </div>
      </motion.div>
    </div>
  );
};

// Component to detect when a section is in view
// Forwarding ref to allow parent to track scroll progress
const ServiceSection = React.forwardRef(({ service, index }, ref) => {
  
  // Split items into two even columns
  const midPoint = Math.ceil(service.items.length / 2);
  const leftCol = service.items.slice(0, midPoint);
  const rightCol = service.items.slice(midPoint);
  
  const formattedIndex = (index + 1).toString().padStart(2, '0');

  return (
    <div 
      ref={ref}
      style={{ 
        minHeight: '100vh', 
        display: 'flex', 
        flexDirection: 'column', 
        justifyContent: 'center',
        padding: '6rem 0',
      }}
    >
      <motion.div
        initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }}
        whileInView={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
        transition={{ duration: 0.6, ease: "easeOut" }}
        viewport={{ once: true, margin: "-100px" }}
      >
        {/* Number Marker - Floating, subtle */}
        <span style={{ display: 'block', fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.9rem', color: '#999', marginBottom: '1rem' }}>
            {formattedIndex}
        </span>

        {/* Title: H2 size */}
        <h2 style={{ fontFamily: 'Instrument Serif', fontSize: 'clamp(2.5rem, 4vw, 4rem)', lineHeight: 1, fontWeight: 400, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '2rem' }}>
          {service.title}
        </h2>
        
        {/* Description */}
        <p style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '1.25rem', lineHeight: 1.5, color: '#1a1a1a', marginBottom: '4rem', maxWidth: '600px' }}>
          {service.intro}
        </p>
        
        {/* 2-Column List Layout (No Bullets): Smaller, Lighter, Tighter */}
        <div style={{ display: 'grid', gridTemplateColumns: '1fr 1fr', gap: '2rem', maxWidth: '800px' }}>
          {/* Left Column */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', gap: '0.5rem' }}>
            {leftCol.map((item, i) => (
              <span key={i} style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.95rem', color: '#888', lineHeight: 1.4 }}>
                {item}
              </span>
            ))}
          </div>
          {/* Right Column */}
          <div style={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', gap: '0.5rem' }}>
            {rightCol.map((item, i) => (
              <span key={i} style={{ fontFamily: 'Inter', fontSize: '0.95rem', color: '#888', lineHeight: 1.4 }}>
                {item}
              </span>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>

      </motion.div>
    </div>
  );
});

// Component to handle the sticky image reveal based on scroll
const StickyImageLayer = ({ service, triggerRef, index, isFirst }) => {
  // Use scroll progress of the corresponding text section
  const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll({
    target: triggerRef,
    // Start revealing when the top of the text section hits the bottom of the viewport
    // End revealing when the top of the text section hits the center of the viewport (or slightly earlier to lock it in)
    offset: ["start end", "center center"] 
  });

  // Map scroll progress to a clip-path "wipe" effect from bottom to top
  // If it's the first image, it's always fully visible (no mask)
  const clipPath = useTransform(
    scrollYProgress,
    [0, 1],
    ["inset(100% 0 0 0)", "inset(0% 0 0 0)"]
  );

  return (
    <motion.div
      style={{
        position: 'absolute',
        top: 0, left: 0, width: '100%', height: '100%',
        backgroundColor: '#fff',
        zIndex: index,
        clipPath: isFirst ? "inset(0% 0 0 0)" : clipPath,
        willChange: 'clip-path'
      }}
    >
      <img 
        src={service.image} 
        alt={service.title}
        style={{ width: '100%', height: '100%', objectFit: 'cover', display: 'block' }}
      />
    </motion.div>
  );
};
```
